leaflet.candidateName: Reg Adams, Jonathan Burns, Paul Nash

messages.title: Labour reduced to just a single ward
messages.content: The Labour Party has been struggling in the area, now reduced to just one ward.

messages.title: Oyster PAYG at Clock House
messages.content: The candidate promotes efforts to introduce Pay As You Go oyster ticketing at Clock House station to bring it in line with London.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Will keep Council Tax low and ensure that everyone is fairly assessed.
Will work to bring the feel of East and Central Bromley together with a fairer Bromley for all.
Will ensure that all streets are kept clean, graffiti removed promptly, and antisocial behaviour tackled.
Will work with local businesses to arrange and support community, encourage back into shopping centres by ensuring it is attractive and safe.
Will fight to restore the rail service and improve the overcrowded and unreliable bus service that the area currently has.

mentions.candidate: Reg Adams, Jonathan Burns, Paul Nash
mentions.tacticalSituation: The leaflet notes a tactical voting consideration by indicating that Labour and the Conservatives are no longer the strong choices for the constituency.

housing.content: Will ensure that all streets are kept clean, graffiti removed promptly, and antisocial behaviour tackled.

images.caption: Photos of the candidates Reg Adams, Jonathan Burns, and Paul Nash with contact details.
